lexUnit.name: dine.v

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: Eat dinner. "We dined at a restaurant."

sentence.text: I believe he dined at your establishment on the -- th of the -- th this year .
Whistler was dining at Tudor House , and the wombat was brought on the table with coffee and cigars .
The noble owner returned around nine o'clock , and renewed his acquaintance with Dr Johnson , with whom he had once dined in London .
In the superb ` Grand Canal " restaurant you dine in style on local specialities which have won the chef great acclaim .
Not as good as yesterday evening when I dined on roast chicken , not very well cooked , but certainly much better than this homely fare .
( Opposite , middle ) Anyone who has dined on crab or lobster will know how well the hard carapace of these animals protects their soft flesh .
Once again they dined on their bland diet of soup , meat and biscuits .
We dined on spicy fish which repeated on me for most of the evening in the Jac , meeting pals , until I drowned it in an ocean of beer .
They dined on lobster and barbecued kebabs , sitting Arab-style , cross-legged on the floor .
Miguel drove her -- in the jeep -- to the nearest fishing port , and they dined simply on paella and lager .
Henry VIII was the first monarch to dine on turkey , but Edward VII made it fashionable to eat at Christmas .
It was not every night , she reflected , that she dined with a secret agent .
Within minutes , he has told me he will be seeing the PM this afternoon , and that he dined with Mrs Thatcher the previous evening .
` We insist you dine with us . "
Skippers Bistro in Dock Place has a real nautical atmosphere and good seafood as has The Waterfront where you can dine outside from May to September .
A mix of all the classic T.V. game shows ` live " while you dine , with prizes for the lucky contestants .
Some restaurants in the old town feature musical entertainment while you are dining , including fado and piano music .
Andrew and his wife dined alone that night .
Everything is sold here , from clothing to souvenirs to electronic goods , and the market is known for its street-side food stalls , where you can dine inexpensively on seafood .

Because Shenzhen is much cheaper than Hong Kong , it is a popular weekend destination for Hong Kong 's Chinese , who come to relax , dine in its resorts , and play golf - Shenzhen hosted the World Cup of Golf in 1995 .
Whether you choose to dine in one of the Macanese , Chinese , traditional Portuguese , or international - style restaurants , you will be treated to a hearty meal at a good price .
